summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate movements, staffing shortages, and equipment status. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations
events.description: Routine operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center including inmate transfers, placements in special housing, staff shortages leading to vacated posts, and equipment issues.

events.title: Flight Cancellation for Treaty Transfer
events.description: Inmate Jones's treaty transfer flight was cancelled due to mechanical problems, resulting in his return to the facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This routine prison operations report is dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.
The report indicates significant staffing shortages, with multiple correctional assignments (Sanitation, Phone Monitor, Sally Officer, Rec Officer, SHU posts) vacated due to a lack of staff.
A fire panel in the Control Center is noted as remaining inoperative, indicating a potential security/safety issue.
The report details inmate movements including placements in Special Housing Units (SHU), a dry cell, new admissions, and releases.
The document provides institutional totals, showing 759 inmates in the facility at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 9, 2019.
